ios.subtitle: The family game of your life!

editorialNotes.standard: Switch on the laser pointer! Scoop the litter! Rub the belly of the all-seeing Pig-a-Corn! This mobile version of the insanely irreverent card game brings the fatal felines to our devices, along with a few purr-fect new twists. The hysterical illustrations by Matthew Inman (creator of The Oatmeal) spring to life with animation and soundâand a meter that tracks the chance of drawing an exploding kitten makes the game even more hilariously tense. Played face-to-face with friends or online against strangers, itâs surprisingly strategic and cat-astrophically fun.

name: Tsuro - The Game of the Path

editorialNotes.standard: This gorgeous digital board game couldnât be any simpler to learn, but true mastery lies at the end of a long and winding path. As fans of Tsuroâs tabletop incarnation, we love how faithfullyâand beautifullyâthe experience is re-created here. App-exclusive ways to play add new layers of depth, letting us get lost for hours among these tricky, twisty trails.

name: Chess ~ Pro
artistName: The Chess Solitaire Sudoku Factory Ltd

editorialNotes.standard: Whatâs made OLO game one of our multiplayer favorites since 2012? The way it perfectly captures the friendly fun of real-world shuffleboard and air hockey. Virtually anyone can jump into a match (locally or online) and have an amazing time flicking discs into the target zone for pointsâand slyly knocking an opponentâs discs away to lower their score. Elegant and irresistible, Sennepâs all-ages masterpiece lets up to four players enjoy games that can be as casual or hardcore as everyone wants them to be.
Throw shade on your opponents by growing taller trees than them in this gorgeous mobile reimagining of the popular strategy board game.
